data.title: Alan Rickman
data.meta_description: News about Alan Rickman, including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.
data.text:
Alan Rickman (1946-2016)

Alan Rickman was a magnetic stage actor who found worldwide fame in film.

In Alan Rickman the Stage Actor, an Erotic Blend of Desire and Conscience

Though best known for the “Die Hard” and “Harry Potter” movies, he was even more compelling as a serpentine seducer onstage.

By Ben Brantley

Alan Rickman, Watchable Villain in ‘Harry Potter’ and ‘Die Hard,’ Dies at 69

The British actor brought an erudite dignity to film roles like the nefarious mastermind of “Die Hard” and the dour master of potions in the “Harry Potter” series.

By Dave Itzkoff and Katie Rogers

ArtsBeat

‘Seminar’ to Close on Sunday

Theresa Rebeck’s comedy will close on Sunday, May 6.

By Erik Piepenburg

ArtsBeat

Justin Long to Make Broadway Debut in ‘Seminar’

The TV and movie actor will play an aspiring novelist opposite Jeff Goldblum in Theresa Rebeck’s comedy.

By Scott Heller

ArtsBeat

Jeff Goldblum Will Pick Up The Red Pen in ‘Seminar’

Jeff Goldblum will take over the lead role in Theresa Rebeck’s play about a caustic writing teacher and his students.

By Patrick Healy

Theater Review | 'Seminar'

Shredding Egos, One Semicolon at a Time

“Seminar,” a new comedy by Theresa Rebeck, concerns aspiring novelists who sign up for classes with a celebrated fiction guru, played by the droll Alan Rickman.

By Ben Brantley

TimesVideo

Excerpt: 'Seminar' on Broadway

A scene from Theresa Rebeck's new comedy about a class led by a formidable writer, played by Alan Rickman. (Video courtesy of the production.)
